result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane H Landvatter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent - THC [Modifiers: Repeater, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain high school diploma. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Comply with treatment at Harvest Consultants. Pay all outstanding ZCI fees. Follow all rules at mother's home. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: Community service hours to be completed during term of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St- Plea to Ct 1 as Amended to Poss of THC as misdm, and to Ct 2 as charged, DRI Balance
Rights given
P - Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt Ct 1 as amended and Ct 2 as charged. DRI Ct 3. 

Cts 1 & 2 - 270 Days RCJ I&S - conc
Probation 2 years - conc

No alc/cs
Comply w/treatment at Harvest Consultants
Obtain HS diploma
30 Hrs CSW
Pay ZCI fees
FT Employment
Follow all rules of mother's home
Ct 1- $100 plus costs
Ct 2 - Waive costs
Provide DNA - pay fee

May petition for expungment after successful completion of probation
Jury trial on June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Shane H Landvatter in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def - Req trial date
  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Pretrial adjourned off the record - per agreement of parties - new date in two weeks
Pre-trial conference on January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Shane H Landvatter in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, NS.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780) exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Shane H Landvatter in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. 
Defense objects to probable cause in count 1. Moves to dismiss. 
BTC: Dismissal of count 1 is denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
